intro: Zaluzianskia gymnocarpa, commonly known as the smooth-seeded morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces trumpet-shaped flowers in shades of purple and white. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its seeds are enclosed in a smooth, capsule-like fruit, which is characteristic of the genus. Zaluzianskia gymnocarpa is often found in wetlands and along the edges of streams.
